bioghist.p: The United Presbyterian Alcohol Information and Action Network was formally organized and granted chapter 28 status by the General Assembly in 1978. It was formed to encourage the UPC to educate its membership in the responsible use of alcoholic beverages, to raise awareness about the pressures in society which result in the abuse of alcohol, and to urge groups and individuals within the church to participate in the treatment of alcoholics and their families. Margaret Fuad and William Ailes were elected co-presidents of the organization.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the United Presbyterian Alcohol Information and Action Network. Materials include: correspondence related to the group's formation; newsletters and brochures; materials related to an ecumenical conference on alcohol problems in the church; and the appearance of the Network at the Youth Triennium in 1980. The collection also includes: by-laws; pamphlets; copies of papers and articles from other church organization an alcohol use and abuse; results of a 1979 questionnaire of church members about alcohol usage; and a small number of organizational records, including information on fundraising, treasurer's reports, and agendas for meetings.
